response.answer_text: The Domain people cost a few dollars more (14.95) but in any case, don't host your site with any of them. Becuase we waste a lot of time dealing with hosts that make everything as difficult as possible, we highly recommend using a top-rated commercial host like www.bluehost.com They allow you to add a key-word rich name for no extra cost that can be pointed to your .ca site. Bluehost actually answers the phone and walks you through any problems. We've had outstanding service for 6 years now for almost all our clients at www.kitsmedia.ca.

.ca is the internet country code top-level domain for Canada and almost all the top domain registrars are offering .ca domain registration services. .ca domain registration by Namecheap ~ Price: $11.98/year .ca domain registration by TEMOK ~ Price: $19.00/year .ca domain registration by OnlyDomains ~ Price: $24.99/year .ca domain registration by nominate ~ Price: $40.00/year

.CA is a canadian ccTLD (country code top level domain). To buy this type of domain you need to be located in Canada, or be owner of a Canadian trademark. If you don't have local administrative contact in Canada you should use services of special domain registrars like this one: Registration of .CA domain in Canada with Local Trustee service that provide you a proxy registration service via Canadian based agent.

I suggest not going with a one-stop-shop for ccTLDs, that can end in tears and usually always costs more. Go with a solid, reputable, reliable and cost-effective LOCAL registrar, such as https://www.namespro.ca
I've been buying .CAs from http://netfirms.ca. Their prices are good and support is responsive. $9.95 for the first year, $11.99 after.
